results.title: The Risk of Age-Related Macular Degeneration Is Reduced in Type 2 Diabetes Patients Who Use Metformin
results.text_hl: ...Background: Whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may reduce the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@age-related macular degeneration@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@AMD@@@) requires confirmation.

results.title: Dose-response association of metformin use and risk of age-related macular degeneration among patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus: a population-based study
results.text_hl: Several retrospective clinical studies demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may have a potential role in @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@AMD@@@ development, while active treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is associated an increased risk of @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@dry AMD@@@.

results.title: Using Advanced Bioinformatics Tools to Identify Novel Therapeutic Candidates for Age-Related Macular Degeneration
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was identified as the drug with the strongest association with wet @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@AMD@@@ genes and is among the top candidates in all @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@dry AMD@@@ subtypes.
